alert.note: Alert for Des Moines (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 8:05PM CDT until May 08 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR HANCOCK...HENDERSON...WARREN...MCDONOUGH...SOUTH CENTRAL DES MOINES...LEE AND EASTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 805 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Middle Grove to near Alexandria, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Macomb, Fort Madison, Keokuk, Monmouth, Carthage, Nauvoo, Bushnell, Hamilton, Warsaw, Colchester, La Harpe, Roseville, West Point, Dallas City, Donnellson, Montrose, Stronghurst, Kirkwood and Blandinsville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
